1.content: "The hardest part of any journey is the first step. Right now there are but a few windows open with which you may interact. Perhaps in time there are others that shall unlock for you. So please, be my guest and choose a window. Then we shall see whom it is you must decide the destiny of."
1.title: Windows

11.content:
Ah you have chosen Riktal from the world of Elthain. He is a bit of a hot headed boy who has gotten into a lot of trouble because of his temper. He is a tenth generation Monster Combat Specialist. Who has been trained to take over the family business.

Elthain is a world of sword and sorcery. Where monsters roam around and terrorize towns which struggle to prosper. Everyone in this world has the ability to learn magic, though some are more proficient at it than others. Mostly magic is weak unless trained and so the people have taken to creating magical artifacts to compensate.

There are few powerful healers in this world, those that are strong in the healing arts are those who have been gifted the powers from a divine being which they worship as a god. Whether he is a god or not I am not qualified to answer. Since I cannot even tell if I am a god or not. Such a title was given to me by another.

With this little information I leave you to your own devices. I shall not interfere with you unless I must. I will simply do what I have always done and observe. What fate awaits you I wonder? What road shall you lead young Riktal down? How shall his first day of school end? Though keep in mind, while you can control the choices young Riktal makes, you cannot control the choices everyone around him will. So even if the situation is the same down two different routes, the outcome may most certainly be different depending on the choices everyone else made on that timeline among the infinite possibilities.
11.title: The gold framed window

choices: Just give your first name nothing else
111.content:
Man this was such a pain. Why did I even have to come here anyway? I had already passed all the qualifications to become a Combat Hunter. But no. That wasn’t good enough for mom and dad. You’re still only seventeen they said. You need to finish school they said. Try to play nice and make friends they said.

I tried at the last school, I really had. It wasn’t my fault everyone just got on my nerves. They wouldn’t leave me alone and acted like I was too good for them. It wasn’t my fault I had almost killed the principal because I had finally had enough of him gunning for me. He had had it in for me from day one. Ever since he had found out who my family was. He just hadn’t let up until finally I had enough and put a sword through his chest.

I looked down at my new school uniform. Shiny metal gauntlets against my hands and magically reinforced leather breeches and shirt. There had been more of course but I saw no need for a helmet, chest plate, and leg guards. I mean really, the uniform choice was a bit outdated. Combat Hunters didn’t wear this garbage when they went out. At least I had never seen any of them wear it. But this was one of those traditional schools. Where those who were from old families or had above average aptitude went.

So now I was stuck repeating the tenth grade. This class was probably full of whiney rich kids who didn’t know which end of a sword to hold or the first thing about loading a gun. That or overbearing brainiacs who wanted to make you feel small by overcomplicating everything.

Take it easy Riktal. That’s how you keep getting into trouble. Isn’t that what big sis is always saying? You overanalyze and turn molehills into mountains. You haven’t even met any of them yet. Keep your cool and keep to yourself for now. Let them do their thing and you do yours. In the end we are all on the same side. We all want to become Monster Hunter's. This is a fresh start. No one knows me here so they don’t have any expectations of me. They don’t know anything about my past either. This is a chance for a fresh start. I can do this. I just need to keep my temper in check. No killing anyone on the first day.

I took a deep breath, quickly running my hand through my red and orange hair as if that would make the short cropped locks less noticable. Pushing my glasses up on my face absently with my middle finger I opened the door to the classroom and stepped inside, gripping my duffle bag tighter with my left hand.

Eyes. Twenty pairs of eyes turning to stare at me. Some narrowing in speculation, some glaring, a few even uninterested. But all of them focused on me. I felt uncomfortable as the teacher motioned me over to stand next to him.

“Ah! You are a bit early! Class! This is the new transfer student.”

He looked at me with a smile I felt was probably fake. He knew who my family was and he was probably already trying to get into my good graces. That was what all the other teachers did.

“Would you care to introduce yourself?”
111.title: Enter the window...

choices: Ask why she is given special treatment
1111.content:
“My name is Riktal. Nice to meet you.”

I stood there as they all continued to stare at me. What did they want? I didn’t know any of them. I wasn’t going to give them any more information then they needed to know. Mine was an old family, I wouldn’t be surprised if a few of them would know the name and try to get buddy-buddy with me for that reason alone.

Mr. Yetz coughed a moment before smiling again in the uncomfortable silence.

“Yes, well. Thank you for the introduction. Your seat is that empty one in the back of row four.”

I gave him a quick nod before heading between the rows, ignoring the eyes that followed me until I found my seat next to the wall. Before doing anything else I swivled the desk at an angle so my back could be partially protected and nothing could sneak up on me. I dropped my bag, hearing the faint clinking of the weapons inside knocking together. My father would knock me into next week if I were to ever forget to bring at least a half dozen weapons wherever I went.

Quickly I sat down and pulled out my textbook on alchemy as the teacher returned to his discussion on making health potions. Propping my elbow on the desk and my head on my hand I let out a another sigh. I had mastered the three levels of healing potions long ago. Big sis Ulinia had pounded that into my head by the time I was fourteen. I probably knew more about it than this teacher did.

But I had to at least make an attempt to pay attention. It was bad manners to ignore someone out of hand. You never knew when they might surprise you with some extra little insight or tidbit of information you could use. My mother had knocked that lesson into me when I was five.

As Mr. Yetz continued to drone on about the properties of the vierra plant and how the length of time you cured the Niploc leaves determined the potency of the concoction, I fingered the bronze hilt of the dagger at my right hip. Even though a dagger was part of the school uniform, this one held extra importance to me. My dad had gifted it to me last month as proof that I had passed all his tests with flying colors. It was my unofficial badge of a Monster Hunter. Toying with the knife made me reach up and touch the red ruby inset in the silver chain around my neck. My mothers gift for passing her courses, just like the gold and silver ring on my finger was big sis’s gift when I had passed hers. Yet they still forced me to come to school.

I glanced around the room then, noticing a girl at the last desk by the windows with her head down. It looked like she was sleeping but I couldn’t tell from here. A closer look around proved that everyone else saw her, they kept glancing in her direction quickly before returning their eyes to the front. The teacher saw her lack of attention as well, simply ignoring it. Just what was going on here? What was wrong with these people? Why didn’t they say anything to her? It just wasn’t right. I would have been beat around the yard until I was black and blue for doing something like that.

Mr. Yetz finished his lesson and sat behind his desk while the rest of the class worked on study sheets. The girl next to the windows turned her head to the side and I could see her eyes closed, a bit of drool coming out of her slightly opened mouth.
1111.title: Just give your first name nothing else

11112.content:
"So why does that girl over there get special treatment? Seems a bit unfair if you ask me."

I just couldn't let it go. If I had to suffer through these classes and I didn't even need them, why should someone else get a free pass? Even if they were some sort of genius, that was no excuse in my book.

The sounds of scribbling suddenly stopped as the tension rose in the air. The teacher glanced at the girl a moment before giving me one of those fake nervous smiles of someone who was afraid.

"She's, special."

"Meaning you are afraid of her or her family. Special or not, rules are rules right? If you bend them for only one person for whatever reason then how is that fair to the rest of us? And you better not give me some bull line about their being mitigating circumstances or something like that."

The boy sitting in front of me turned around and shook his head.

"Just give it up, it's not worth it. We all used the same argument before but nothing ever happens. Her name is Liz Hawthrope and she is ranked number one in the Combat department. Even if her academic grades suck she gets a free pass because she can lay the smack down on all the teachers here. Everyone is afraid of her, it's an open secret that the teachers don't want to admit."

I looked at Mr. Yetz who glanced away slightly and I let out a tsk of disgust.

"Well if you aren't man enough to say something to her then I will. I was at least raised with a little bit of respect. And I'm not going to be cow-toed over some threats of violence."

There was a small gasp as I stood up and strode over to the still sleeping girl. Some were whispering that I was being foolish and stupid, others that I was going to get myself killed. I ignored them all as I leaned against the windowsill and crossed my arms. With a massive heave I kicked out my foot, my boot smashed into the underside of the desk and lifted it up a few inches. It came crashing back down, making her head bounce as she woke up startled.

"Glad to see you finally woke up. So mind telling me why you think you don't need to stay awake in class? Since you probably weren't awake earlier, I'm the new guy. And my feelings are a bit hurt you didn't even have enough respect to be awake for that occasion. Everyone seems to be afraid of you but frankly I'm not."

She looked at me with her blue eyes as the bangs of her purple hair slipped down her forehead. Finally she laid her head back on her arms and turned her head away from me.

"Buzz off."
11112.title: Ask why she is given special treatment

111121.content:
I grabbed her by the hair, lifting her head up for a split second before smashing it back down as hard as I could into the desk. I saw the blood spray out as her hand reached down to her side where her knife was. I was already spinning around behind her and was on her right side by the time she swiped at me. With a quick flick of my fingers I had my own dagger in my right hand. As I reached over to clamp my left hand on the fist with the knife, I smashed my own blade into the back of her left which was still flat against the desk. It buried itself up to the hilt, even as I forced her right hand to bend downwards and thrust her own blade into her side. I applied a bit of magic to my arms to increase my strength as I held her pinned.

“I don’t know who the hell you think you are or what you think of me but frankly I don’t care. You might be some genius messiah of combat training but if so you seem lacking to me. If you think combat is all there is to becoming a Hunter you are mistaken. I can only imagine just how little academic knowledge you may or may not have.

“So let me enlighten you to a little human anatomy 101. I just shoved a six inch blade deep into your side as you can probably feel. That queasy feeling you have right now? Like you are going to throw up? And that wheezing sound you hear? That’s because I just punctured your lung. Soon the blood will start to come up your throat as it is pushed out by the pressure. Unless you get medical attention within a few minutes you are going to die. You will die faster if I pull this knife out just so you know.”

Blood began to leak out of her mouth as her eyes went wide.

“Now. If you paid attention at all in any classes except combat you might, just might know a few minor healing spells that every Hunter learns. But they won’t work. Since I am imbuing your blade with my own magic to counteract any healing you might possibly do because I want you to suffer. There is more to being a Monster Combat Hunter then simply the physical combat. A good Hunter has an active mind that soaks up everything around them. I don’t care how good you are or how good you think you are. The Association doesn’t need a Hunter like you who can’t show even a small amount of respect. What I just did is what a monster will do to you one day.

“Now if you answer my question I might even let you live. If you want to be stubborn then by all means say nothing and I will watch the life slowly drain from your eyes as you struggle in vain to take just one more breath. So I ask again, mind telling me why you feel you don’t need to stay awake in class?”

She coughed up some light pink blood and wheezed a bit as she tried to suck in more air. I gave her three more minutes before her body finally gave out and she died. The realization that she was about to die seemed to finally hit home and her eyes grew larger as the fear set in. She struggled weakly, her energy draining quickly. Her struggling only made the time she had left that much less as she tried using air she didn’t have. Finally she gave a final blood filled cough before looking at me to give her weak reply.

“Because I already know all this stuff. I’m a fifth generation Hunter. My parents forced me to attend school even though I should already be out in the field.”

“See? Now was that so hard?”

I pulled my blade out of her hand and let go of the knife in her side, halting the flow of magic I was sending down the metal. I wiped the blade clean on my pant leg before resheathing it. She was trying to heal herself, her hands glowing a pale white, but her magic was weak. Most of her energy had been spent in her struggling. Left to her own devices she would probably still die.

Giving a small mental shrug I returned to my seat. It wasn’t really my problem.
111121.title: Continue to confront her

1111211.content:
Before I could sit down my conscious got the better of me. I was trying to make a fresh start wasn’t I? Reinvent myself? My temper was always getting the better of me, making me do things that I regretted later. Even if I didn’t like her on first impressions I still had to help her. Lord knew I wasn’t the easiest person to get along with at times and people had still helped me.

Stooping down I dug through my duffle bag and found the spelled pouch I had gotten a few years ago as a gift. Opening it up I ran my fingers over the wax sealed lids until I found the small vial I was looking for. Pulling it from its seat I strode back over to the girl still trying vainly to live a second longer. I thrust the vial of red liquid with small purple spots floating in it towards her.

“Here drink it.”

She looked at me with that slight stupor of someone who’s vision is going blurry but finally took the vial from me, breaking the seal with her fingernail. She spat up a bit more blood before downing the liquid and pulling the knife from her side.

I was actually impressed by the way she handled herself even in this situation. I hadn’t heard a gasp of pain from her since I had thrust my knife into her hand. She had bore the pain like a true Hunter, which was more than I could say for most people claiming that title I had met. Her body glowed with a purple aura for a second before she began to breath easier, the blood finally halting its flow from her side and mouth. Without another word I turned and headed for the door.

“Where are you going?”

I looked at Mr. Yetz as if he was stupid.

“To the principals office of course. There are rules about fighting and harming other students after all. Rules are made to be followed unless there is no other choice but to break them. A Hunter is trusted because he follows those rules and upholds the order they represent. I made a choice to break the rules and so now I must face the consequence. If I think myself better than the rules just because I am stronger or smarter or come from an old family or whatever other reason I can think of, then I am no better then a common monster. Without rules there is chaos, and a Hunter does not promote chaos. Isn’t that basic Combat Hunter 101?”

I left the room then and headed down the hall. My mother would probably pull me around by my ear and give me a lecture for getting into trouble on the first day. Not that she would actually care, as a mother. She would simply do it to put up the appearance of caring. I wasn't even an hour into my new class and already I was letting my temper get the best of me. Why did I have to be wired like this anyway? With such a short temper and everything seeming to set me off? Why couldn’t I be more normal like everyone else?

I pushed my glasses back up my nose before entering the main office and saying I was here to see the principal. I took a seat when offered and waited. It didn’t take long before I was up again, being directed into the principal's office to stand before her desk.

She was visibly older. Some women I knew tried to hide their age but she didn’t. Her gray hair was done up in a classical bun as the wrinkles lining her face told a story of many smiles and a merry attitude. She was slightly plump but not fat, simply the creeping paunch of age since she no longer actively hunted.

She gave me one of the smiles that transformed her face to that of a woman fifteen years younger. It was a sincere smile, one that reached her eyes which gave a small twinkle.

“So what can I do for you Riktal? I wasn’t expecting you back so soon.”

“I stabbed and almost killed a girl named Liz Hawthrope. I have no excuse.”

“No excuse? No mitigating circumstances? No reason for your actions? You just simply decided to stand up, walk over and stab the girl for no reason?”

“No excuse ma’am. Any reason or reasons I might have had do not factor in. The same with my actions afterwards. The fact still remains that I stabbed and almost killed her. So I came here to accept my punishment.”

“You said almost, so she is still alive?”

“Correct.”

“So I take it Mr. Yetz gave her a healing draught?”

“No ma’am I did.”

“Why? You had already shown you had intended to kill her by stabbing her. Did you feel guilty? Were you forced into it?”

“No ma’am. None of that. In truth I felt no guilt at all. A Hunter has no need for such things as guilt when he commits to killing his prey. But I am well aware of my own hasty temper. It has gotten me into a lot of trouble already. I am simply trying to make a new start here. Giving her the health potion is something I would not have done before. Since it is not what I would have done at my old school, I decided to go against my ideals and help her. That is the only reason.”

She rubbed her eyes a moment before looking at me again.

“Your family is one of the oldest around. You are great Combat Hunters. It’s for good reason you are all ranked within the top twenty in this nation. But I’ve told your father time and again, teaching just the technical aspects isn’t good. Told your grandfather too but he wouldn’t listen. You just lose something in the process if you don’t loosen up a bit and let a child be a child.”

“I’m not blaming you for the way you see the world. It was how you were raised and trained after all. I know all about how you are already Hunter class. It's in your profile after all. You are more than qualified and honestly you don’t need this school. But perhaps you can learn a bit of flexibility here even if we don’t have anything new to teach you. Try to make some friends and loosen up. That is all, you may go.”

“But what about my punishment?”

“You decided to save her life, I don’t think a punishment is warranted. I don’t run this school like most others. It is folly to think there will be no fighting between the students and no accidents. We teach you to use weapons of every kind after all. If I punished everyone who hurt another on accident or not I’d never find time to rest. It’s all about that flexibility I was talking about. Now if you had not helped her that would be a different story. Your act of kindness mitigated your act of temper.”

“But you still must punish me! The fact still remains I stabbed her. If you don’t it will be seen as you giving me preferential treatment because of my family name. I’m no better than any other student here.”

“Fine you want a punishment? Then as your punishment you have to make two friends in the next two weeks. You may go.”

She pointed to the door and I turned and left while shaking my head. What was she thinking? What kind of punishment was that? Two friends in two weeks? She must be letting me off easy because of my family. It was the only explanation.

The bell rang signaling lunch just as I made it to the staircase. The cafeteria was right down the hall, but my duffle bag was on the second floor. We would be going back to the same classroom after lunch, only the teacher changed out of the rooms in this school. Should I get my bag and take it to lunch with me? Would that be considered weird? If I was going to have to make friends it wouldn’t do to be seen as the weird kid. But a Hunter never went anywhere without his gear in the field.

My stomach grumbled loud enough to wake the dead. I realized I hadn’t eaten anything since dinner last night, so I pushed the hunger pangs to the side as I tried to decide what to do.
1111211.title: Help her

11112111.content:
No I had better get my bag. There were dangerous weapons in there I didn’t want falling into the wrong hands. Granted everyone in this school was a Hunter in training and I would think they honored the codes of our profession. Especially the one that stated a Hunter’s weapons were sacred and not to be messed with. Sometimes such weapons were handed down from generation to generation. They were an extension of the Hunter and anyone caught stealing one could be shunned to the point of having to quit being a Hunter.

Still, even knowing all that it was best not to push fate. Wasn’t there a law somewhere that stated if something could go wrong it would? So ignoring my grumbling stomach I climbed the stairs and walked down the silent hall towards the classroom. As I got closer I heard voices coming from inside. I didn’t think much of it until I heard some of their words which made me stop and listen for just a few moments.

“Man would you look at this! This is a bona fide Lexington double barrel! Do you have any idea how much these things cost? With a bad boy like this even a D class Hunter would be a mach for a low B class monster! I wonder what augmentations it has on it!”

“Come on Gregory, put it away. It’s not yours and you shouldn’t be going through his things like that!”

“What’s the harm in looking huh? I mean don’t you want to know too? Didn’t you hear the clank or feel the magic coming off this bag when he walked in?”

“No I’m not interested! If he wants to show us that’s his business. Otherwise you have no right to do this. It’s really close to breaking the code!”

“Why you acting like you aren’t a part of this? You didn’t leave so you are just as guilty. Hey look at this! These are a high grade fist weapon that would be great for you. Never seen ones with blades on the knuckles before.”

“They are called Roller Knuckles. Hey don’t shove them on me I don’t want them!”

“Well now that you’ve touched them you are just as guilty as me so don’t go blabbing or you will get in trouble too. I mean, aren‘t you the least bit curious of how it would feel to use them?”

“I am a little, but this is wrong!”

I had heard enough. And I felt the anger beginning to make my blood hot. What would have happened if I had gone to the cafeteria first? Would they have ended up stealing my weapons? What kind of damage would they have caused? Yanking open the door I strode inside and headed right for them. One of the boys was in the process of bending down to put my knuckles back in the bag while the other one was staring down the sights of my Lexington, pretending to shoot monsters with it. They both saw me and got scared as I let an evil grin cover my face.

“So you’d like to know how it would feel to use them huh? I’ll make sure to arrange that for you. See? Am I not generous? Now put them away.”

The boy who had already dropped my gloves backed up while the one with the gun failed to catch my false courtesy. His eyes grew round and a look of greed came to his eyes.

“Really!”

By this time I was close enough to him as I smiled even wider.

“Yes really.”

With that I sucker punched him in the face, causing him to real backwards. In one swift motion I used my foot to kick one of the roller knuckles into the air, grabbing it before it fell and pulling it onto my right hand before he recovered. Clenching my fist together the three small circular saw blades inset into the knuckles spun madly.

“You better use it on me now before I tear up that face of yours with this glove.”

With that I charged him, my right fist cocked back and the blades spinning threateningly. He reflexively pointed and fired at me like it was any other gun. As the bullet came out he was lifted off his feet and thrown backwards from the kickback. The bullet flew towards me and stopped in mid air as I ignored it. His back smashed into the window and the only thing that prevented him from falling to the ground was the fact that I grabbed his leg at the last moment. I heard his head bounce against the wall and the clatter as my weapon dropped from his hand, discharging once again as it hit the ground.

With one hand I pulled him inside and threw him on the floor, giving his stomach a kick for good measure.

“You went through my bag without permission, that’s strike one. I won’t count it against you for using it because I told you too. But you let it fall out the window to the ground, that’s strike two. On strike three I don’t give you any more chances. That weapon is much too high a level for you to use right now no matter how shiny and nice it is. I dare you to test me. Now get out of my sight before I really hurt you, but know I will remember your name. Gregory.”

The boy crawled on all fours and then ran out of the room as he managed to get his feet under him. With a sigh I pulled off the glove and took it back to the bag. Looking at the other boy who was backed against the wall as if afraid of what I would do to him I nodded my head towards the door.

“Get out of here. I’m not going to do anything to you. You at least had the sense to try and stop him and you were already putting it back. I’ve got no beef with you.”

He ran towards the door, stopping before he left to look back at me.

“Uh, can I ask how you stopped the bullet?”

“No secret. It’s my gun and it’s tuned to me. I’ve got an augmentation on it so I can’t get shot by it. Would be stupid to be hurt by your own weapon don’t you think?”

He nodded and ran out of the room as I went back over to the window. Avoiding the shards of broken glass I got up onto the sill and leapt to the ground, using a bit of magic to cushion my fall. I found the Lexington and quickly inspected it, finding only minor cosmetic damage. Tracing the stray bullet I found it had only made a hole in the base of a wall, nothing to worry about there. Tucking the weapon into my belt I began climbing back up the side of the building, thrusting from window ledge to ledge and grabbing the small bits of handhold on the brick face until I was back inside.

I was putting it away in the bag when the door opened again. Looking back I saw it was one of the girls from class. She completely ignored me, having a sort of faraway look on her face as she went to the back of the room and began tending a plant that was back there. Once she was done she turned around and seemed to see me for the first time, giving a start of surprise.

“Oh! I’m sorry! I didn’t see you there! You’re the new kid right. Rikky? Richard? Randy? What was it again?”

“Riktal.”

“Riktal. Why does that name sound so familiar? Oh yes! You’re the Zelkov that’s going to help me.”

“Wait how do you know my last name? Who told you?”

“What do you mean? He told me of course.”

“He? He who?”

“The One God. He speaks to me. He told me to become a Hunter. My parents don’t believe me of course, I don’t know why. Shouldn’t a priest and priestess believe the most?”

“You’re a priestess?”

“Well not exactly. I never took the rites so I only know some of the healing spells.”

She came over to me and laid her hand on the side of my face with that absent look in her eyes again. I felt a bit of the warm glow the divine powers all servants of The One God possessed as her head cocked to the side.

“You are lonely, angry and have a feeling that you are trapped. There is much pain inside of you that you hide well. You seem stable on the outside but inside it is a fine balancing act that can topple you in every direction at any moment. I do not know how to help you though but I know you will find the answers you seek if you make the right choices. There is a girl in your near future. One that can become close to your heart if you let her and will ease those feelings inside of you, giving back something you once thought lost forever.”

She blinked as her hand fell away, looking up the few inches into my eyes.

“I did it again didn’t I? I had one of my divinations. I’m sorry if it freaked you out like it does the others. The urge just comes without warning and I can’t help myself. A lot of people think I’m a bit weird and I guess they are right.”

With that she went to her desk and pulled out a small box which she opened to reveal neatly packed food. Taking out a fork and saying a quick prayer she began to eat. I had a feeling this was normal for her, eating alone in the classroom. She was probably a bit of an outcast because of her power. Even though most people would be all over her trying to become her friend since she was a healer normally, those sudden burst of divination kept them at bay. Not to mention that far away look that seemed to cross her face at random. I would bet she was probably communing with her god in some way, but these kids didn’t understand that, probably not having dealt with servants of The One God before.

My stomach growled again, reminding me that I was still hungry. My eyes were drawn to the door and then to the girl again.
11112111.title: Get duffel bag

111121112.content:
Letting out a sigh I went over to the desk in front of the girl, pulling out the chair and sitting on it backwards. I rested my chin on the hands I folded along the back as I watched her for a moment but she didn’t seem to realize I was there or care.

“So do you always eat alone?”

She started in surprise at my words before blinking at me.

“Oh you’re still here? I thought for sure you’d run away like everyone else after I tell them about their future. But yes. I find this more peaceful and the birds sometimes come join me so it’s not all that bad. So you don’t need to worry Richard. Wait no, that’s not right. What was your name again?”

“Riktal.”

“Oh yes Riktal Zelkov! Sorry, I’m not all that good with names, just faces. Keep telling me and I’m sure I’ll remember it some day.”

“You’re a bit of a weird one I’ll give you that, but you aren’t that strange. I’ve dealt with servants of your god before and seen that same faraway look. God-touched they call it. Not to anyone’s face of course because you act like the word is cursed.”

“He is everyone’s god not just mine or anyone else’s. And why would they see that word is cursed? Would they not want to be touched by God? Are not all priests and priestesses touched by Him?”

“I’d say ye of little faith but that really doesn’t apply to you now does it? You really don’t know much of anything of what goes on behind the scenes of the Church do you?”

“Not really. I’ve always been able to talk with Him and my parents said I didn’t need to know right now.”

My stomach grumbled again and I pushed it to the side. I felt this meeting was somehow important. Maybe destined. It wasn’t the first time I had gone a day or more without food for training, I could push through it. Even though the sound wasn’t loud the girl still heard it, putting some of her food on the lid of her box and pushing it over to me, handing me the unused spoon next to her meal. She did so absentmindedly, like the thought of not helping me or not feeding me never crossed her mind. That’s why I accepted the small offering with a gracious thanks and started to eat.

Before the first small spoonful of rice met my lips I saw the girls eyes watching me. Feeling a bit ashamed I set the spoon down and bowed my head, saying a quick prayer of thanks. This seemed to make her happy as she continued to eat her meal with me.

“I’m not sure how much to tell you of what I know goes on behind the Church doors, seeing as you are still technically a priestess and all. But the truth is, the Church isn’t what it used to be. Back a long time ago every servant of The One God could commune with him. That’s how they all got their powers after all. But somewhere down the line, they got their powers from him but stopped being able to hear his voice in their heads. They don’t publicize this fact of course, continuing to promote the idea they all hear him to the general public. Even promote the belief to those in training to become servants until they take the final rites.”

“Now I’m not saying they are corrupt or anything. They still do good work and they provide valuable assistance not only to Hunter’s but to the poor and needy that we Hunter’s protect. In the last few Hundred years those who can still commune directly with the god, the real God-touched, have certain destinies or reasons for being born. Now I don’t know what your reason is until you complete it, but I am sure you will find out when you are ready.”

I refrained from telling her those who were truly God-touched also usually ended up dying in horrible ways at very young ages. Some lived to old age, but most of them were either set upon by the mob who condemned them, their own Church who felt threatened by them, or by their destiny.

“Oh I already know. Well at least I know what it is right now. He told me it was to save Riktal Zelkov. He also said he had other plans for me.”

“And how are you supposed to save me?”

She shrugged a moment before stuffing another forkful in her mouth.

“I don’t know, he didn’t say. He just said I would know when the time was right.”

“Sorry, I forgot those that can truly hear his voice don’t question at all. They simply follow and obey knowing it will all work out. People like me that can’t hear him like you question everything.”

She nodded knowingly.

“It is sad, but that is the way it is. Not everyone can hear him but everyone can come unto him. But I do not understand why it is you know so much about the Church that I do not when you are not a servant.”

A bird flew in through the broken window, a kestrel by the looks of it. It swooped down onto the table next to us looking to the left and right in that jerky bird way. The girl crumbled up some bread and laid it on the desk so the bird could pick at it before returning her attention to me. She really was one of the chosen ones. I had always known there was a god that oversaw this world, he had made his presence known many times. But this was the first time I had seen someone he was personally taking care of like this. All my information about the God-touched was secondhand, the ones I had thought had this communion with him had only been faking it ot keep up the farce. I smiled at her, feeling a warmth inside just from being in her presence. Even though I tried to make my smile happy, I could feel how it was tinted with sadness. As if I was regretful that I was tainting this girl with my presence.

“Because, no matter how much light you cast upon the land, there will always be shadows. I simply deal with that darkness.”

“Let the man who knows the evils in man’s heart’s combat the evils in the name of good. Even if he sinketh into the pits of darkness as he uses those evils he shall be lifted up to the exulted seat for his works. For though he has sinned against me, still he has done my works and I shall not strike him down nor shall I deny him the blessings of my presence. Amisada chapter ten verse twenty.”

“You know, I don’t even know your name.”

“It’s Lilia. Lilia Hawson.”

“Well Lilia, I don’t know how it is I am supposed to help you, or you save me, but if you ever need anything then you let me know. It’s true that I might not hold much stock in The One God, but I also believe he exists. I have no doubt that you really are one of his servants that can hear him and you follow his commands. I have no desire to get struck down for not helping you or turned into a frog in my next life or something. In the end the servants of The One God and Hunter’s are in the same business.”

“Then would it be ok if I speak with you again?”

“Whenever you wish. I’ll make time for you. That is if you don’t mind if I eat lunch with you from now on.”

“Really! You’d do that! Truth be told it gets a little lonely here sometimes. It’s not always that bad since I have my bird friends and He talks to me sometimes, but I do like talking with other humans from time to time, they just always avoid me.”

“I know the feeling of being lonely. I don’t mind either, I can use the company. Besides, how could anything go wrong when I know The One God is eating with us?”

We finished our meal as the bell rang, but we ignored it as we continued to talk about different things. It was the first time I didn’t feel awkward or angry or annoyed when dealing with someone my own age. Even though I was terrible as a people person, everything just felt right around her. The class began to file in then as she put her empty box away and I didn’t miss the looks sent our way. Nor the bits of whispering as the rumors began to emerge. Standing up I gave her a parting smile before going back to my seat. The smile she returned was full of that warm glow of divinity she seemed to possess in spades.

The teacher came in and called out roles before closing his book and addressing the class. This was the hands on section of Alchemy, where they would learn to mix concoctions by applying what they learned before lunch. I’d have to use one of the lab sets in the back of the room since I didn’t have my own kit yet.

“Class. Today we have a special guest who has graciously consented to teach you. She is a renowned potion specialist from our very own Efenbis city. Ranked number two in the nation and seven in the world, she has helped advance the skills of Alchemy to new limits.”

Oh please no. Please don’t say my big sisters name. Please god if you really are listening prove me wrong.

“She’s a tenth generation Hunter with a lot of experience under her belt. Please welcome Ulicia Zelkov.”

They all looked around in surprise, all eyes focusing on the door in expectation. But my sister wouldn’t do something as mundane as use a door. She was a flashy show boater who would probably use a teleportation potion. Indeed that was exactly what happened. A column of green smoke appeared in front of the teachers desk and my sister stepped out of it, throwing her hands out wide as if to embrace the entire room at once.

She wore a red long sleeved shirt, though only one sleeve still remained. The one along her right arm was ripped off up to the shoulder to showcase the tribal tattoo running all the way down to her wrist. A pair of loose fitting jeans ripped at the knees that seemed to be held up by magic were wrapped with spelled wire to hold an array of bottles of all colors. Each bottle as long and narrow as a finger and capped with wax. Her hair was blue on the left half and yellow on the right today, pulled back and tied in a ponytail. The purple eyeliner seemed oddly out of place when compared with everything else.

She looked around the room and saw me sitting there in the back, a grin splitting her face as she hopped onto the first desk and ran straight towards me as nimble as a cat.

“Riki tiki!”
111121112.title: Stay with the girl

1111211121.content:
I simply sat and waited. Trying to avoid her would only make matters worse. Either because of the scene we would make or the possibility of getting others involved. Besides, at least one of us had to act like the adult here.

She leapt over the two boys in front of me with her arms wide open, wrapping them around my neck as her weight bore me backwards to the floor. I suffered her squeezing me tightly while rubbing her cheeks all over my face. When she began to rock me from side to side squealing happily I finally had enough, trying to push her away. She continued to stay latched on for a moment more, adding a few kisses in for good measure before finally releasing me, jumping to her feet to stretch.

“All right! Tiki tanks fully recharged! Tiki reserves also completely energized! I’m finally alive again!”

She looked down at me as I started to get to my feet, a puzzled look coming to her face momentarily.

“What are you doing here anyway Riki? I thought for sure mother and father would take you slaying with them. Or at the least let you take the Exams so we could work together.”

“Yeah, you and me both. Seems you’ve been left out of the loop, but I guess I shouldn’t be too surprised at that, it’s the way mother usually operates. Mother seems to think I need to finish three years here before I’m ready to get my license.”

“Well I think you should just go take the Exams anyway! Who cares what that old fuddy-duddy says anyway! We both know you’re ready for the big time. And then I can recharge my tiki tank anytime I want! We can work together all the time! Just think about it Riki!”

“Yeah… I’d rather not. I bet you are more worried about getting your tiki juice on a regular basis then you are about me becoming a Hunter.”

“I won’t deny it.”

She grinned as she embraced me again, rubbing her cheeks against my face a moment before letting go.

“I thought your tiki tanks were filled.”

“I used some tiki juice so I was just topping off.”

“Well hurry up and get to teaching the class. You’ve already made enough of a scene for one day, now act your age.”

She let out a sigh as if she were somehow suffering, making the simple act overly dramatic before standing at attention and giving me a salute.

“Sir, yes sir!”

She began to giggle then as she turned around. I started to pick up my chair when she jumped and spun in a circle, clapping her hands as she landed.

“I know! Why don’t you help me teach Riki tiki! You know all of this just as well as I do and with two of us we can get more done! What do you say Riki tiki!”
1111211121.title: Do nothing

11112111211.content:
“Fine. Just quit calling me Riki tiki. I haven’t been that for almost ten years now.”

She bounced up and down like a giddy schoolgirl who just got to meet their idol in person before trying to hug me again. This time I evaded her clutches, pointing at the front of the room sternly. With a sigh she finally turned and began to teach while I followed behind her quietly.

“You should all know by now Alchemy is an art. It’s not based on gut feelings or eyeballing measurements‘. It’s a strict formula of A plus B equals C all the time. You can’t replace A or B or put a small decimal on one of them to make B.00001 and expect the same results. Anyone can master Alchemy as long as they have the required materials and knowledge.

“But as Hunter’s we have a leg up on most other people. We can control our magic better than other people can. That means we can create potions and elixir’s that a regular civilian alchemist cannot. We can also hunt our own ingredients, which is sometimes the only way we can make a potion, since the ingredient we might need is bound to us until it is used. Like the essence of Swamp Creepers. That stuff floats around you like a bad odor you just can’t get rid of for a few days no matter how much you scrub. But you can make a powerful potion of sleep with it that when used properly can put a small army of B class monsters to sleep even if they are normally immune to such spells.”

She continued speaking for a few moments longer before telling them to pull out their mini labs while instructing them on how to make a basic healing potion. As she began to drift out into the room to the left I headed towards the right. She continued to tell them exactly when to add ingredients, when to stir and other tips while the two of us stopped at each desk for a bit of personal help. When a hand was raised with a question the person closest or who wasn’t already occupied would answer.

It felt a bit weird teaching my classmates like this honestly. I was beginning to second guess my decision to help out. But then again, if I had declined what would I have done with my time? Probably make a potion on my own. Perhaps a translocation potion to give to Lilia in case she needed my help. But I could do that at home and it would need to be put into an artifact to be most effective.

I could see a few goofy smiles on faces left over from the show my sister had put on and a few speculative glances my way, mostly by the girls, as they tried to think how best to get into my good graces now that they knew I was a Zelkov. But despite how flippant and easygoing the class had seemed earlier, they took the lesson seriously, they treated me and my sister with respect and asked serious questions. They knew this was their life and their future on the line, and that this information could make or break them as Hunter’s. So there was very little calling me over on the false pretense of asking a question only to try and flirt with me or something stupid like that.

Everyone finished making their potions, a few even managing to make a tier two version, shortly before the bell rang. Liz of course had no problems, simply grinned at me when I looked in her direction with eyes that seemed to know I was a bit uncomfortable. While they packed their potions and labs away carefully my sister came up behind me, pressing her body against my back while hugging me around the neck.

“Oh it felt so good to work with you again Riki tiki! I wish I could stuff you in one of my bags and take you with me everywhere I went! I never have to worry about anything when you are around! I was able to focus on my group because I knew you were there! What do you say? Ditch this place and run away with me to my next job!”

I extracted myself with a sigh just as the bell rang, turning with a slow shake of my head.

“You know I can’t do that. We both know that would just end with a big fight between me, you and mother. Even if it didn’t, I’m still an unlicensed Hunter. You’ll get in big trouble with the union if you took me out with you. Perhaps enough for you to lose your license as well depending on how dangerous or confidential the job is.”

She pouted a little before finally nodding her head with a downcast look.

“I know, I know. You be careful Riki you hear? I don’t want anything to happen to that precious tiki juice. I’d die without it! I have another job to do so I’ll be away for a while, not sure how long though. I’ll see you when I get back ok? Give mother my love when you see her!”

With that she pulled another transportation spell off her belt and smashed it on the ground. The green smoke flared up seconds before she stepped inside and was gone.

“Don’t call me Riki tiki!”

I had to wonder if the words made it through the spell before the gas had fallen in on itself to disappear. With a sigh I grabbed my weapons and headed off to Combat class. It didn’t take long to toss my duffle into a locker and head out to the arena. I didn’t need to gear up like everyone else or use my own weapons. Most of what I had was higher grade anyway. It would be best if I just stuck to stock weapons in any sparring mach. Things still wouldn’t be even, but at least it would be a bit fairer.

The Arena Master told everyone that today they would be fighting real monsters in groups of four or five to put their knowledge into practice. The class began to murmur excitedly as he told me and Liz to sit this class out. With a shrug I turned and headed for the bleachers, at least this would be a good chance to get an idea of the general skill levels of my classmates.

I had barely sat down though when Liz came bounding up the steps until she was standing right next to me.

“Want to have a bit of fun? I got the Arena Master to agree to give us our own little section of the floor to spar together if you want. You don’t have to of course, but I’d like to see how good you are. So what do you say?”
11112111211.title: Help her teach

111121112111.content:
I saw the kick coming for my head out of the corner of my eye as Liz shoved my arm to the side, trying to hide her attack in her counter to my open palm thrust. I let my knees buckle as I dropped my body, throwing my head back so the strike sailed harmlessly inches over my nose. As I continued my fall I rotated my wrists and shoulders, planting my palms on the cool cement floor. Bunching my muscles I thrust forward with both feet leading but she blocked it with crossed arms. My attack was still strong enough to lift her off her feet and send her flying though.

I was already on my feet, taking three quick strides forward before sailing into the air by the time she landed. With a quick frontward flip I came barreling back down, aiming to pile drive my feet into her stomach where she was laying gasping for breath. At the last moment her midriff bunched up as she rolled backwards with her legs crossed at the knees.

My attack missed by inches even as her lower half surged forward, locking my neck in the crook of her crossed legs. With a grunt she lifted me bodily into the air using only the power in her lower body while doing a handstand. I felt my body moving sideways as she spun on her hands quickly a few times, my body flowing outwards by the centrifugal force. Suddenly she let go and I was free flying, unable to control myself.

I saw her do a break dance move while I flew, dropping her lower half as she spun to her feet and leapt into the air like I had. My back met the cement hard, softened only a little by my quick use of wind to buffer me. I watched her do the same flip in the air as I had even as I rolled backwards. But I wouldn’t let it end there, she had shown me something good, time to repay the favor.

While she was still falling I shoved off from the ground with my legs leading. Right before I hit her I crossed them just like she had, slamming into her neck and twisting sideways with my upper body. I couldn’t spin in a circle like she had, but I got enough momentum to let gravity do the rest of the work. I let her go as I floated a little higher into the air from the maneuver, finally hurtling back towards earth as well.

Her back bounced against the ground and she let out a gasp of pain, having time only to see me falling towards her. I saw the flicker in her eyes as she rapidly went over everything she could do, realizing I would hit before she got out of the way. Saw her gathering earth magic to harden her skin to try anyway.

At the last second I spread my legs and hit the ground on either side of her, bending my knees to absorb some of the blow. With a grin I sat on her waist and patted her cheek lightly.

“I win.”

Standing up I offered Liz my hand, which she took with a small sigh and a grin of her own. We both heard some cheering around us as we went to pick up the two sets of swords we had both started out with. Looking around with a bit of surprise we saw the class watching through the walls that had turned opaque as glass. The Arena Master was also grinning as we moved towards them, part of the wall sliding back into the floor to let us out of our own personal sparring arena.

“The rest of the group couldn’t concentrate on their monsters once they heard your clash through the walls. So I let them take in the show and maybe learn something. Hope you don’t mind.”

I shook my head along with Liz, both of us saying we hadn’t even noticed at almost the same time. We looked at each other then laughed a bit, replacing two of the swords on their racks and putting the two with broken tips in the pile with a few other broken weapons. We both grabbed towels that were freely provided against one of the benches as we sat down on the sidelines, thinking it best we not spar anymore so the rest of them could get back to getting real combat experience.

“I didn’t know you knew that last move too.”

“I didn’t until you used it. I simply adapted it with what I already knew.”

“Geez, and it took me almost a week to master it! Is that part of being a tenth generation?”

“Nah, I’ve just learned to adapt and analyze quickly. There are loads of things it’s taken me a while to get right. You should have seen me when big sis started teaching me Alchemy. If it could be blown up, I’m pretty sure I managed it. I couldn’t even get the most basic of potions right. Just didn’t have the head for the math. All those numbers didn’t make a whole lot of sense. In the end big sis would sit with me for hours at night going over math drills until I got good at it before she even let me near the ingredients again.”

“Well that makes me feel a little bit better. Alchemy has always been one of my best subjects. My big brother used to say my brain was better than a calculator. I loved all the number stuff and the formulas. By the way, what was that one move you did called? The one where you juggled one of your swords on the other to block my attack and then grabbed it out of the air when I hit it. I‘ve never seen it used before.”

“It doesn’t really have a name, just something I picked up from a friend I know. Though he usually does it with daggers. Still, it’s all about the balance.”

“Well it was impressive. Took all I had to get my other sword up in time to block the follow-up backhand blow. If I had been a few seconds slower that would have been my head.”

“Well your head if the blades hadn’t been spelled for sparring. I was impressed by the rapid chain of fist and elbows you threw after we broke our swords.”

“You mean the Lightning Tiger Barrage? It’s my mom’s signature move. She has the nickname of Sleeping Tiger you know. All sweet and docile until you get her angry then she’s like a wild unchained tiger that’s as hard to catch as lightning. I’m more interested in that move you did where the air seemed to spiral around your fists and it looked like a phantom claw.”

“You mean the Twisting Demon Punch?”

“Yeah if that’s what it’s called. Mind teaching me how to do it?”

“Shouldn’t be too hard. You got enough skill for it.”

“You don’t have to be modest. I can tell I was outclassed. I might have gotten a few good hits in and held my own for a bit, but I know you were holding back. I’ve been around enough strong fighters to know that much.”

“Ok so I was holding back. Still you’ve got skill, I’ll admit that. Definitely B class worthy, perhaps almost A.”

I saw her blush a bit as she ran her fingers through her hair, hooking a few stray strands behind her ear. I wasn’t sure why she was getting embarrassed over the truth. Especially after our bodies had been locked together as they had been the last fifteen or twenty minutes. If me grabbing her breast or her my crotch as we threw each other across the floor didn’t make her embarrassed, why should this?

I simply shook my head privately. For all that she was like me, a Hunter in all but truth, I guess she was still a girl. I never could understand the minds of women and I probably never would. Especially ones around my age with all their nonsensical thoughts and alien ways. Still at least I could deal with Liz since she was able to shove those girly ways to the side like any real Hunter could.

We chatted for a bit more, going over details of our sparring match and saying what we were impressed with or what we needed to work on. Suddenly the bell rang and I was startled back to reality. Had we really been talking for almost thirty minutes? I had to be careful from now on, I couldn’t let my guard down like that again. Not paying attention to your surroundings was a sure way to get killed.

The two of us broke off then, following the rest of the class back to our respective locker rooms. It only took a few moments to grab my duffle bag and head out the door since I didn’t have any gear to put away like the others.

Once back in my seat I watched the class trickle in, seeing the looks of worship and scheming cast in my direction. With a sigh I mentally prepared myself for the onslaught of plots to befriend me, bed me, or milk me. Even in a Hunter academy you still found such politics. No I shouldn’t be surprised, Hunter’s plotted more than even dirty politicians sometimes. It really wasn’t a wonder that they started while still in training.

The bell finally rang again as the teacher stepped into the room to take attendance.
111121112111.title: Spar

choices: Take job and negotiate better terms
1111211121111.content:
“One of the many changes that Nesta and Gint brought about was a uniform monetary system. Before this, each country had their own determination not only of the value of the coins which they minted for use within their own lands, but also for weight, purity, and exchange value. There had even been fighting if you took money from one country to another in an attempt to use or exchange it depending on the political strife at the time. For example, Judaris and Tachikal were both long time enemies, even more so than they are today. If one were to even bring a Judaris minted coin into Tachikal they would be killed without question. Even if it was a devout patriot of Tachikal who held a single coin, he would be cut down.

“But with the implementation of the Reul bills, also known as the hundred coin base, on a global level; small wars and tense relations between nations dropped dramatically. Now, no matter where you go one Senz coin will always be worth one Senz coin. One hundred Senz will always equal one Knutz and one hundred Knutz will always equal one Reul. The only difference is in the price of items, a suit of armor might cost ten thousand Reul here while over in Bornica it might cost fifteen thousand. These prices are dictated by the wealth of the nation and the ruling government, be they king, dictator, president, or council.”

Before the teacher got any farther into his lesson a woman came through the door. She was a looker with her bright red hair tied up in twin ponytails. A red that was more than a match for mine, almost giving off it’s own glow. With a single finger she pushed a pair of gold rimmed glasses farther up on a small nose, her pale white skin accentuating the deep purple eyes. Her breasts seemed to be almost bursting out of the white button up shirt she wore tucked into a pair of no nonsense black business pants. With a clipboard tucked under one arm she marched over to talk to the teacher quietly.

I was already picking up my bag as the teacher looked in my direction, motioning me forward.

“Yeah I know. I assume my father want’s to see me. That’s the only reason I can think of that your here Jara.”

With a small nod the woman gave the teacher a bow of the head, apologizing for interrupting the class before the two of us left the room together. While we walked I could hear the slight clanking and creaking of her prosthetic left leg, though she somehow managed to walk without a telltale limp for all of that.

“So what does my father want with me?”

“I think it is best if he discusses it with you himself. Besides, talking out in the halls here isn’t safe. Prying ears and eyes you know.”

Her voice was a bit deep and clipped, but I had grown used to the slight brusque tone of hers. I knew it came from the years she had spent as a Hunter before she lost her leg. She had been the captain of one of the associations quick response teams, dedicated to stopping S class monsters that posed a threat when they got too near cities. Or to act as the associations private standing military when needed. Though I still wasn’t sure why she had decided to give up her position and work for my father as one of his aides. Even without her leg she was still a brilliant strategist and a good leader, even if she couldn’t exactly fight like she used to.

I’d worked with her a few times on random jobs while my father was off on business and she was free. I had learned the basics of tactics and strategy from my father and mother, along with the books at home. But it had been this woman who had really fleshed out that knowledge, expanding it vastly while showing me how to use it in practice. I had a healthy respect for her skills of both body and mind, having been dumped on my backside by her on more than one occasion.

“Can you at least tell me if I am going to like what I hear?”

“From what little I know, probably not. It’s not all bad, but it will probably leave a bad taste in your mouth.”

She didn’t say anything else as she led me to a small room who’s only furnishings was a table, six chairs, and a set of shelves holding some books. A single window looked out on a track where a class was running laps. My father was already sitting in one of the chairs around the table, a little girl with hair as white as fresh fallen snow trailing down her back and eyes the color of sunset. She held a teddy bear to her chest with her right hand while she stared straight ahead with lifeless eyes, not even turning to look at the noise I made coming in.

Jara walked over to the nearest chair, sitting down and grabbing her left leg. With a grunt she manually lifted it up to rest on the tabletop before leaning back in the chair. I could see the edges of the shiny metal skeleton leg that went up to her knee and the set of hydraulics at the back allowing her some movement.

“Well I brought him like you asked. Though I personally think it would have been better if you had come alone. You didn’t really need me except as a buffer.”

“Please Jara, we’ve been over this. You know what’s at stake here.”

My father glanced over at me before shaking his head and returning his gaze to his aide.

“We’ll discuss this in more detail later.”

“As you wish… sir.”

Taking off my glasses I rubbed my eyes trying to squelch the rising frustration of being left out of the loop again. Putting them back on my face I sat down across the table from him and the little girl.

“So what do you want father? I doubt it is just to see how I am doing. You wouldn’t do something so mundane and normal as that anyways.”

“You made him angry.”

“No, he’s angry at you. All I did was escort him here like you requested. I told you how you should have handled this but you didn’t listen.”

My father let out a sigh as he rubbed his eyes with two fingers. I noticed the dark circles under them then, and a few more gray hairs since the last time I had seen him almost a month ago. Even though I knew he still had a powerful build, the way he slumped over slightly across the table from me gave the illusion that he had lost all that muscle.

“This isn’t going quite like I had planned but would you look after this girl for us for a few days? Only until someone can come pick her up. Her name is Asala and she could really use someone like you.”

“Mother put you up to this didn’t she?”

“Why do you say that?”

“Facts. You weren’t supposed to be back until next week, yet here you are. It is entirely possible you picked her up on your last job, but that is a low possibility. If you had picked her up, I at least think enough of you to assume you would take care of something like this without toting her half way around the world to bring her back here. Second you said us, not me. You only say us when you are covering for mother in some way. So my guess is she landed in mother’s lap, mother didn’t want to deal with her, so suckered you into taking the girl off her hands and bargaining with me in hopes of getting a better deal since she knows my feelings for her.”

Jara barked out a laugh from the end of the table as my father glanced away from my eyes.

“He got you there Romone!”

I saw the little girls fingers curl around the teddy bear and let out a sigh. Getting angry wouldn’t solve anything. It wouldn’t get me any answers either. Not that I expected to get answers to begin with no matter what kind of emotion I was in or questions I asked.

“So? What’s so special about her anyway and what kind of concessions did mother want you to get out of me?”

“She’s a monster summoner. An unstable one at that. This lifeless shell you see before you? She did it to herself. Ran off into her head and shut down all her senses. Refusing to even eat or sleep on her own. She doesn’t even control her bowels or bladder, just letting them go whenever she wants. Your mother put a diaper on her and has been supplementing her bodies needs with magic.”

“And I told that damn fool of a wife of yours what a cockamamie move that was. I still stick by that too. It aint right for a girl her age to be swaddled up. Even if she want’s to run off into her head, she still deserves some dignity. But what do I know, I’m just an aide now. It’s not like I used to be a Hunter or anything.”

My father ignored Jara’s comment as he kept his eyes locked on mine.

“The only other thing she wanted me to get out of you was to have you continue going to classes. I told her that was crazy, especially considering how little love most people have for summoners to begin with. Throw an unstable one who can’t control where, when or what she summons and it’s a recipe for disaster.”

“Why not leave her with Jara then? She seems to have no problems with it and she can deal with kids reasonably well.”

“But not as well as you can. Besides, I think I might have scared her deeper into her head when we first met with one of my tirades. You know how difficult it is to recover from a bad first impression, especially with a trauma victim.

“What about Pelei?”

“He’ll do it, but I’d rather you took the job son. Pelei is a good guy and all, but I don’t feel right leaving her with him. She needs mental and emotional help, not just physical. And in that respect I think you might be the best person for her.”

“How do you know? You’re never around to see what I can and can’t do.”

“I don’t honestly. All I know is what other’s have told me really. But I just got a gut feeling about this.”

Jara had been right, this did leave a bad taste in my mouth.
1111211121111.title: History class

11112111211111.content:
“No deal. At least not as it is. I’m not taking a little girl like this to school with me, no matter what mother wants. I’ve grown more than tired of being jerked around by her whims. You want me to take this job? That’s fine. But I take it on Hunter terms. I might not have a license yet, but this is still a professional level job so you need to deal with me as a professional. If I take this job I want a guarantee that mother will stop shoving arranged marriage proposals off on me. Plus I don’t hear any backtalk about me taking the Exams after this job is done or any interference from either one of you to stop me.”

“What, you don’t want any money?”

“Money is fine and all but I can make my own. What I want is better than something so common. I want freedom. Freedom I can’t get with you and mother cock-blocking my attempts to be what you trained me to be. Though to be fair, it’s more mother than you, but I never once considered you on my side in any of this. Once I am a Hunter I can make all the money I want. I can move out and leave that house and never look back. That is what I really want father.”

“Those conditions seem kind of steep son. I’m not all that adverse to them but your mother will definitely have a problem.”

“Tough. When going into negotiations know your enemy. If you know what they want and how badly they want it, you can push for more concessions as you hold more cards. Isn’t that what you yourself taught me father? If mother and you want me to take this job bad enough then you will pay. If you don’t then that’s fine, take her to someone else. What I want right now is more important to me than mother’s flights of fancy. Since you are here now with this girl, then you speak for mother as well. So do you accept my deal or not?”

My father let out a sigh as he rubbed his eyes again. Jara was grinning from ear to ear from where she was silently watching and the girl was simply staring across the table at me with those doll like eyes.

“Fine, I’ll talk your mother into accepting the terms somehow.”

My father gave me a woebegone look as Jara began to laugh and a smile split my face. The rich sound echoing on the walls.

“Don’t let him fool you boy. I figured this might be how the meeting would go down and told him as much. He already talked with the office before I came to get you, letting them know you wouldn’t be in school for a few days. I told him you weren’t a little boy no more so expect some haggling. Glad you didn’t disappoint my expectations of you. Were up to me I’d have sent you off to the Exams long ago. Your good, might even make a captain like I did if that’s what you wanted.”

“Jara…”

“Yeah, yeah. As you wish sir.”

I looked from my father to Jara who was still grinning from ear to ear, not the least bit cowed into submission by my father’s looks. She often said he needed someone to stand up to him and smack some sense into him when needed. And that the other aides were too soft for such a job, being only simple civilians. Not for the first time since this meeting started did I wonder just what these two knew that I didn’t.

“Well is that everything father? If it is then you can leave me to do my work. I’m sure you got a busy schedule and more important places to be anyways.”

He looked like he was about to say something else but shook his head instead, everaging himself up slowly. Jara let her own leg drop with a small clank before getting to her feet as well. She gave me a small wink before following my father to the door. Before leaving though my father looked over his shoulder at me with a bit of sadness in his eyes.

“Take care son.”

“I had planned on it even if you hadn’t said anything. What’s your problem anyway? Not like you to act all fatherly. Kind of creepy actually.”

He just shook his head again and walked out the door, letting the slab of wood close behind him with an ominous click. Once he was gone I sat on the tabletop, spun around and scooted across the space to dangle my legs over the edge next to the girl. As they kicked back and forth I gave her a roguish grin while looking in both directions, one eyebrow raised conspiratorially.

“Just between you and me, despite how much I might say I dislike or hate my parents, I actually still do love them. I think aliens came down from space to implant something in my head to make me do so no matter what. People say aliens are little green men, but I think all they saw were goblins. Real aliens have tentacles. Why every alien has to have tentacles! Big purple slimy ones! I mean, how are they going to do the whole tentacle scenes you see on TV if they didn’t?”

There was no response to my words. No slight smile or twitch of the eyes. I nodded a bit to myself as I thought of what to say next.

“That’s a pretty good mask you got going on there. Not even a twitch of a facial muscle. Did aliens teach you how to do that? Like they implanted thoughts into my brain I mean. But you see, I’m on to them. I know their tricks. They might have made you look and act like a doll, but their control isn’t complete. I think that teddy bear kept them from exerting complete control. Because your fingers have been twitching and tightening against it this entire time. That being the case I bet you can hear me and see me as well. The aliens have just disconnected your mind from your body so you don’t actually react to such stimulation.”

I looked around again before bending my head a little closer to hers while dropping my voice a notch.

“I wonder though. Do you think the aliens would be able to exert complete control if I were to take that teddy bear away?”

I got the reaction I was expecting as her hand spasmodically clutch the bear tightly to her chest. I let out a small laugh as a laid my hand on her white hair.

“Don’t worry Asala, I’m not going to take it. But that does prove to me you aren’t as far under the aliens control as you want everyone to believe. Though I must warn you, when the aliens messed with my head I think the rewired my brain wrong. You see sometimes I get this irresistible urge to spoil cute little girls with white hair and red eyes. I can’t help but hug and squeeze them at random moments. Even plant sloppy wet kisses on cheeks and foreheads. Sometimes, like now, I even get this urge to take them on a shopping spree for new clothes. Nothing a little white haired, crimsoned eyed, girl can do to stop me when I get like this either. So I guess you are just going to have to put up with it until my urges go away. That is, if they go away.”

With that I rolled backwards off the table, picking up my bag from where I had dropped it on the floor next to my chair before returning to the girls side. I held out my hand hopefully but she didn’t take it. With a small shrug I slipped the bag on my back before picking the girl up and bracing her against my side, using one hand acting as a seat while I hardened my muscles up with earth magic. I gave her a quick hug before walking out the door with her in my arms. Her four and a half foot frame was so light it barely felt like I was carrying anything.

“I told you I got irresistible urges. But there is a small loophole in this rewiring they did to my brain. If the little girl in question who is getting spoiled says to stop, the urges go away. I’m not sure why exactly but who am I to question aliens.”

As we headed down the hall towards the front doors I thought I saw the barest flicker of a smile curving her lips out of the corner of my eye. But when I glanced over in her direction not a trace of anything marked her features. Still I smiled anyway as we left the school, my plan was already starting to work.
11112111211111.title: Take job and negotiate better terms

111121112111111.content:
“How you doing Riktal honey?”

“Same as always Sue. Got me an irresistibly cute kid here that needs to be made even cuter. Think you could help me out here?”

I bent over slightly to let the girl stand on her own feet again. Even with augmented strength holding her for the last fifteen minutes like that had started to really make my arm ache. But it had all been part of the act I was putting on for her. She wasn’t making it any easier though. Aside from the fantom grin I had thought I had seen, her face and body hadn’t flickered an inch. But I knew that would change. She wasn’t so far gone as to need that much coaxing. Just enough to realize it was safe to break that shell on her own. At least around me if no one else.

“Aliens came down and messed around with her a bit. Made her wear this fugly dress as well. But it’s all hush-hush you know. Don’t want any of their spies catching wind that we are on to them you understand. You are one of the only ones I can trust that isn’t connected to the aliens in any way.”

Sue’s eyes twinkled merrily as she gave me a lopsided grin.

“I see. Well then I think I have a few clothes laying around that aren’t touched by the aliens. Plus you know how my memory can be, sometimes I forget things that are said and done just seconds after the fact. I doubt any alien would want to bother getting information out of me.”

I gave her a small nod as she took a hold of Asala’s hand, leading her off with me following close behind. As she walked she slipped a pale orange dress off a hanger on her way past without stopping. The act was so practiced and nonchalant I would have missed it if I hadn’t been paying much attention. She took the girl into a dressing room with her while I stood as a silent sentinel outside. They were only inside for a minutes before Sue led her back out for me to inspect. I looked her up and down, stroking my non-existent beard with a raised eyebrow.

“No, no, definitely not. She looks like a sickly fall pumpkin. I don’t get the urge to squeeze her or rub my face against her at all.”

Sue let out a small hmmm with puckered lips before grabbing another dress, this one a deep blue with light blue trimming. I also saw her grab some white panties absently before ushering the girl back into the booth.

It took a little longer this time but when they came out I saw Asala blushing just slightly as Sue gave me a wink over the girls head. Again I stroked my fake beard before nodding slightly. Letting her see the fingers of my free hand wiggling a little.

“Yes, Yes! I feel the urge inside rising! This is good! But one dress won’t be enough. At least three, no, four more! And shoes! Can’t forget shoes! Plus the hair! If you are going to give her a makeover got to do something about the hair too! That’s how they get you. They get attracted to messy plain hair and wiggle in between the strands to invade the brain don’t’cha know.”

Without warning I lunged forward to grab the girl up in my arms, shaking her back and forth as I picked her up while rubbing my cheeks against her face.

“So cute! I can’t hold back anymore!”

It was a good thing she didn’t know I wasn’t normally like this, or how embarrassed I privately felt. This was more my sister’s kind of thing than mine, still it was one of the many effective routes to take. As I set her down I saw her blush an even deeper shade of red as her lips curled into a smile, making my own embarrassment dim in comparison to the progress I was making. It wasn’t like this was the first time I had gone against my nature to complete a job or get what I wanted.

Sue pulled the girl in and out of the dressing room another four or five more times. Each time I could see that shell cracking a little more. Sue seemed to know exactly what to do and say while bouncing off my own reactions and random outbursts of snuggling the girl. She was the biggest reason I had decided on this clothing store, with nearly thirty years of experience in textiles under her belt and being the mother of three girls of her own, she knew how to handle situations like this.

When the girl came out again wearing a light red dress with a skirt ending just past her knees I reached out to grab her up again. She suddenly lifted her hand between us, shaking her head back and forth. With a sigh I stepped back, letting a pout cover my face. The same pout my sister always gave me, that being the only one I actually knew how to recreate. It seemed to work though because she dropped her hand with a sigh before holding out her arms.
